baseline_groups.claim_summary: The closure of the Grand Canal in 1825 increased rebellions in counties along the canal, measured as asinh(rebellion onsets per 100km^2).
baseline_groups.notes: Both baselines test the same claim; baseline has no controls while baseline_with_controls adds larea_after and rug_after. The canonical specification uses unit (OBJECTID) + year FE with clustering at the county level.

global_notes: 65 total specifications. Several specs have numerically zero coefficients due to estimation failures (winsorization at 1/5/10 pct, early_period, late_period, canal_counties_only, non_canal_counties). The pre-treatment trend spec uses a different treatment variable and a restricted sample, making it a diagnostic. The alternative treatment spec (distance_canal) changes the causal object. Heterogeneity specs add triple-interaction terms and thus test a different estimand. Some outcome variants (attacks, defend) represent genuinely different outcome concepts.
